subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] my opinion on the mini box
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
--_e64561fc-8e1c-4e9e-b261-309b18114a4b_
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="_e9acec32-5f7a-4e0d-bfa2-6c18b66f12f6_"

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


So which one of these is not interactive? it's typical of what we all get =
here. That's why I say the haunting stuff is crap, and meaningless. I think=
 maybe it's a matter of definition, some think ghosts and spirits can only =
be at haunted location, which is untrue. Some seem to think when we die we =
become retarted zombies incapable of any intelligent action. 
 
 Frank-S


=
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: erick_hunter9@...: Thu, 15 Nov 2=
007 15:42:06 -0800Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] my opinion on the mini box




Bru=
ce,  the boxes aside,  I am talking about Ghosts, period.  The boxes are fo=
r simple communication,  not inter-acting.  When I say 'inter-acting' I don=
't mean trade a few words,  I'm referring to Meaningful interaction.  Makin=
g a Statement,  passing on a message to me or a living relative,  predictin=
g or causing 'physical' inferances.   I've experienced every kind of Ghost,=
  I feel certain,  all over the world.  I have experience with them that mo=
st people just dream about...or fear.  I have been carressed,  molested,  p=
oked,  probed,  slapped,  punched,  knocked down and physically Picked Up b=
y a Ghost.  I have confronted them face-to-face while they were both visibl=
e and invisable.  I have numerous times held conversations with them via vo=
ice recorder and once even one-on-one (it was the experience of a life-time=
!).  I was Hunting Ghosts many, many years before it became a fad,  or cool=
 to do so.  And,  believe me,  I am far from being an 'expert'.  I do not p=
resume on Ghosts or their personalities.  Every time in the past that I've =
done so,  I've been rocked back on my heels,  psychologically speaking. Som=
e are good,  some are not.  Many of them very much enjoy making you the foo=
l (that's a lot easier done with some people than are others!) .  It doesn'=
t matter in the slightest what you Think of them,  They are what they are, =
 and 'being a friend' is definitely not on their list of priorities!  That =
goes for All of them.  They will play with you.  They will lie to you.  The=
y will tell, or imply to you, what they know you want to hear,  that or the=
y will laugh at you.  I have personally heard their laughter,  on more than=
 one occasion.  The first step in beginning to understand Ghosts is to quit=
 watching stupid TV Ghost Dramas,  and learn to be discernful about Reality=
.  God bless, anyway.        --Rod
 
 
 
 
bruce halliday <paranormalinvest=
igating@...> wrote:


Rod, No disrespect but how do you know what g=
hosts havethe where with all to do? I speak with them through frank and joe=
's box on a daily basis and consider thetwo that are communicating daily to=
 be friends. I believe you are speaking of grounded spirits not etherals an=
d ghosts that are grounded most definately interact with us. residual ghost=
s and hauntings do not that is whythere is a distinction between the two in=
telligent and residual hauntings. but we are not talking generaly about hau=
nting spirits that communicate through frank and joe's boxes, but all types=
 of entities and don't call anyone dillusional unless you yourself have exp=
erienced your own research with the boxes. Bruce 

Bruce Halliday Paranorma=
l Investigating Team 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: erick_hunter9@yaho=
o.comDate: Thu, 15 Nov 2007 14:18:55 -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] my opinion=
 on the mini box



I certainly agree with the point of Bruces' statement, =
 but I fear he's being delusional about 'friends' from the other side affec=
ting some inter-action between a box and the user,  not letting one work,  =
the box chosing it's owner,  etc., etc., etc.  In the first place Ghosts ar=
e Not our Friends!  That's pure, unadulterated Fantasy.
The Ghosts do not h=
ave the where-with-all to accomplish this in the first place, and even if t=
hey did they don't give a rats' rear end what a Ghost Hunter does or doesn'=
t do.  That boy really needs to get real.  Ghosts simply do not re-act to t=
he living in that way, or much of any other way except to allow us to see o=
r hear them and then only when they want it to happen.  Their most obvious =
and biggest trait is to be totally indifferent to our wishes.   Over 40 yrs=
. of Investigating the Paranormal has taught me nothing if it hasn't taught=
 me this.      --Rod
 
 
 velazquez <ghostchasingfool@...> wrote:


H=
ere, here Bruce.  I am glad others who a genuine support my outlook, I coul=
dn't agree more!bhali333 <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote: 


si=
nce I dropped the bomb about this mini box to Frank s. yesterday I did not =
expect such a fervent hoopla about it.So I will give my box experienced opi=
nion after lengthy research with both Frank's and Joe's boxes. I have conta=
cted the manufacturer for an explanation, he instructed me to listen to the=
 audio file and view the demo video on his site. After doing so my opinion =
on this box and the builders intentions for it is.The box itself is not a k=
nock off of Frank's box but a cheap and ineffective version of Joe's box,It=
 works on an AM band instead of an FM band as Joe's box does. Another big d=
ifference is Joe's box actually works and you have all heard the files I ha=
ve posted from sessions with it. After listening to this box and seeing it =
in operation I feel that anyone who purchases this box will be very disappo=
inted and will not receive any contact from it and even if they did they pr=
obably would not even realise it for the simple fact that you have to have =
a certain amount of experience with box research and operation before devel=
oping an ear for picking up real time communication and also creating a bon=
d with the spirit friends on the other side and also a measure of trust on =
both sides.I believe the manufacturer to be a capitalist and only intereste=
d in the monetary reward to be gained from offering this cheap and ineffect=
ive copy to unsuspecting and naive individuals who are interested in this m=
edium. I do not like to bad mouth anyone, it usually comes back to bite you=
 in the ass but I believe that our friends on the other side know of our in=
tentions and would not allow someone with the wrong intentions to develop a=
 working tool for communication. also I believe that a person does not pick=
 the box the box picks the person. So let him have his short and lucrative =
run with this fooling unsuspecting clients, bad karma always comes home.Bru=
ce
